comment.body:
>Ranged http request: video files with seeking support

It will be very, very cool! :)

>The sites limit uploaded files to 200MB during the testing period (There is no limit in the protocol)

I understand that the real size is less? :)

`Include optional files too large 123639376B > 100000000B`

We are looking forward to when you can clone ZeroUp;)
Now the upload `mp4` has stopped working for me at all :) A message is issued - `Only mp4, tar.gz, zip files allowed on this site`.

> [nofish](#comment_234_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Please try now

Excellent! Now it works as it should! True, I've just sent 40Mb for the test :) Thanks a lot!

It works somehow is not clear :) A [file1](/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw/2016%20-%20ARMATA%20T-14%20WINTER%20TEST%20DEMONSTRATION%20_%20HD-cTlErpzDTOI.mp4) of 40MB size is distributed perfectly and is accessible on other servers and a proxy. A [file2](/1uPLoaDwKzP6MCGoVzw48r4pxawRBdmQc/data/users/1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw/ISIS%20suicide%20car%20bomb%20vs%20Iraqi%20M1%20Abrams%20-%20rwLobT5dM2U.mp4) of 118MB in size, laid out just like file1 and on the same computer, on other computers is not available :)

> [jayofthezero](#comment_8_16nArdxrSaNThNp83kL8E6NLL9WD98iUne): you can just do it yourself by manually copying its files to a new Zite you create.

Yes! Finally, I forced the clone to work :) (Raising 1024 times the limits) ;)
Can I somehow make a calculation of `piecemap` from the command line? To add files manually on a remote server, not through a browser?
If I on Linux replace a file located in the user `data` directory with a symlink, then everything works fine. But on Windows - does not work.
It would be useful to be able to add a link in the file description. For example, to discuss a file in ZeroTalk or ZeroBlog comments :)
Thanks for your work. I consider ZeroNet the best decentralized social system!

In ZeroUp I would like to see a description of the files. It is desirable, with Markdown :) And then to many files it would be useful to add details, for example, with a link to the blog, where the detailed information is located.
